ST.xhtml:p:
CAUCHYCD := 0.5 + 0.318309886183791 * ATAN((X - T_Cauchy) / U);
(* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function calculates the Cauchy distribution function

ST.xhtml:p: ATANH := LN((1.0 + x)/(1.0 - x)) * 0.5; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function calculates the angle in a coordinate system in rad.

ST.xhtml:p: ASINH := LN(SQRT(X * X + 1.0)+X); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function calculates the arcus sin hyperbolicus

ST.xhtml:p:
AGDF := LN((1.0 + SIN(X)) / COS(X));
(* comment the current implementation gives sufficient accuracy only up to X = 1.57 or an output > 10. is X closer to PI/2 then the function is more and more unreliable *) (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function calculates the inverse Gudermannian function.

ST.xhtml:p: ACOTH := LN((x+1.0)/(x-1.0))*0.5; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the arcus cotangens hyperbolicus

ST.xhtml:p: ACOSH := LN(SQRT(X * X - 1.0) + X); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the arcus cos hyperbolicus
calculates the stirling function which is an approximation for the gamma function
calculates the beta function for real number > 0.
This is a rounding function which returns the smallest possible integer which is greater or equal to X.
This is a rounding function which returns the smallest possible integer which is greater or equal to X. ceil(3.14) = 4 ceil(-3.14) = -3
This is a rounding function which returns the biggest possible integer which is less or equal to X. floor(3.14) = 3 floor(-3.14) = -4

ST.xhtml:p: exp10 := EXP(X * 2.30258509299405); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the exponent to the basis 10
checks two inputs x and y if they are identical with the first N digits example : cmp(3.141516,3.141517,6 is true
calculates the cos hyperbolicus
calculates the cotangens hyperbolicus

d_trunc truncates a real to a dint 1.5 will be 1 and -1.5 will be -1 d_trunc is necessary because many systems do not offer a trunc to a dint also real_to_dint will not deliver the same result on different systems
This is a decrement function which decrements the variable X by 1 and if 0 is reached, it begins with M again. _dec1(3,X) will generate 3,2,1,0,3,2,...
this function converts degrees into Radiant execution time
This is a rounding function which returns the biggest possible integer which is less or equal to X. floor2(3.14) = 3 floor2(-3.14) = -4
modulo funtion for real numbers modr(5.5,2.5) = 0.5

ST.xhtml:p: DIFFER := ABS(in1 - in2) > X; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function checks if in1 differs more then x from in2 the output is true if abs(in1-in2) > X
calculates the erf (error) function
sgn returns 0 when X = 0 , -1 when X < 1 and +1 when X > 1

ST.xhtml:p: ERFC := 1.0 - ERF(X); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the inverse erf (error) function
checks an input for even value the output is true if the input is even

ST.xhtml:p: BIT_OF_DWORD := (SHR(in,N) AND 16#00000001) > 0; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function extracts a single bit from the nth position from right (right is lowest bit the lowest Bit (Bit0 from in) is selected with N=0

this function calculates X to the power of N (Y = X^N) whilke N is an integer especially on CPU's without a floating point unit this algorythm is about 30 times faster then the IEC standard EXPT() Function
this function calculates the factorial of x if the input is negative or higher then 12 the output will be -1
calculates the fibonacci sequence
this function returns the fraction of a real number fract(3.14) = 0.14
this function calculates the gaussian density function

ST.xhtml:p: GAUSSCD := (ERF((X - U) / (SI * 1.414213562)) + 1.0) * 0.5; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function calculates the gaussian cumulative distribution function
this function calculates the gretaest common divisor of two numbers A and B
this function calculates the Gudermannian function

ST.xhtml:p: GOLD := (X + SQRT(X*X + 4.0)) * 0.5; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the golden function

ST.xhtml:p: HYPOT := SQRT(x*x + y*y); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the pythagorean function

ST.xhtml:p: inc := (X + _D + M + 1) MOD (M + 1); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: This is a increment function which increments the input X by the value D and compares the result with M. if the output exceeds M it will continue to count from 0 again.
This is a increment function which increments the variable X by 1 and if N is reached, it begins with 0 instead of N again.
This function increments the input X by the value D and compares the result with U. If the output exceeds U it will continue to count from L again.

ST.xhtml:p: IF X <> 0.0 THEN INV := 1.0 / X; END_IF; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: This function calculates the result of 1 / X
this function calculates the lambert_w function.
this function calculates the langevin function

ST.xhtml:p: MAX3 := MAX(MAX(IN1,IN2),IN3); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function returns the highest of 3 real values
returns the mid value of 3 real inputs

ST.xhtml:p: MIN3 := MIN(MIN(IN1,IN2),IN3); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function returns the lowest of 3 real values

ST.xhtml:p: MUL_ADD := X * K + O; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function multiplies an input X with K and adds Offset O to the result.

ST.xhtml:p: NEGX := -X; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: This function returns -X

ST.xhtml:p: Rad1 := modR(0.0174532925199433 * _deg , 6.283185307179586476); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function converts Radiant to degrees
this function calculates the closest fraction for a real number
this function rounds a real down to n digits total. round(3.1415,2) = 3.1
this function rounds a real down to n digits behind the comma. round(3.1415,1) = 3.1
this function calculates the sigmoid function

ST.xhtml:p: sign_I := BIT_OF_DWORD(DINT_TO_DWORD(in),31); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function return true if the integer input is negative

ST.xhtml:p: SIGN_R := in < 0.0; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function return true if the real input is negative
this function calculates the sinc function.
this function calculates the sin hyperbolicus
this function calculates the nth root function of X according to the formula sqrtn = x^(1/n).
this function calculates the tanc function.
this function calculates the tangens hyperbolicus

ST.xhtml:p: window := (in < high) AND (in > low); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this checks a signal if the signal is between the upper and lower limit

ST.xhtml:p: window2 := (in <= high) AND (in >= low); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this checks a signal if the signal is between the upper and lower limit including the two limits
